alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 9:39AM CDT until August 01 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Missouri and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Pettis and Saline. In west central Missouri, Johnson MO and Lafayette. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 AM CDT, Between 3 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen across the advisory area. Heavy rain has ended, but flooding concerns may remain through the remainder of the morning hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sedalia, Concordia, Sweet Springs, La Monte, Smithton, Green Ridge, Corder, Alma, Houstonia, Emma, Hughesville, Aullville and Sedalia Memorial Arpt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
